question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, or (2) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The market resolves YES if Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will either Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games or Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events are scheduled from Thursday, Aug. 1, to Sunday, Aug. 11, with Sha'Carri Richardson competing on the following days: Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3, Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9. (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either the Russian flag, The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russian athletes participating. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition resolves as NO. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this part resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, according to the ISW map criteria, or (b) the linked market has at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024.

Details:

(a) **Russia control of Chasiv Yar**: This part will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

This part will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(b) **Market traders**: This part will resolve as **Yes** if the market embedded in [this link](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: 

(a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, this part resolves NO.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Otherwise, this part resolves NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The data will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as Yes if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the eventual nominee on the election day.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, or will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting. (b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6, 2024. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. If neither of these conditions is met, the question will resolve to "No".

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will either the Boeing Starliner depart the ISS by July 21, 2024, or will a geomagnetic storm with Kp > 4 and <= 6 occur between July 17-28, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) The Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner must undock from the ISS and begin its return journey to Earth. The resolution will be based on official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, or a consensus of credible reporting. (b) The highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel expands its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024. This will resolve Yes if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

(b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics. This will resolve Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and is not influenced by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither condition (a) nor condition (b) is met.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Resolves YES if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as NO for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as YES. This resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before the end of July 2024: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes, or (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person is required for it to count. If such an interview occurs before the end of July 2024, this condition resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

(b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6, where one poll includes Joe Biden and the other includes a generic Democrat. If the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with the generic Democrat by 3% or more, this condition resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days, or (b) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? The resolution will be based on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

This includes appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls are excluded. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, lasting ~70 minutes. If no qualifying interview is released by the end of July 2024, this resolves NO.

(b) Ted Cruz: The question resolves as YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is irrelevant who receives the nomination on the day of the election; it solely depends on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. If Cruz is not selected, this resolves NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur on July 15, 2024: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

The question will resolve as "No" if neither of these conditions is met on July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves to **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

1. **10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024:**
   - Resolution source: [NY Times Biden Drop Out Democrats](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html)
   - If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this condition will resolve to yes.

2. **Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President:**
   - This condition will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.
   - The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If neither condition is met, the question resolves to **No**.

question.title: Will either the USA win more Gold than Silver medals or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes" for (b).

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will either Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model or Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13th?
question.body:
This resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. Otherwise, this resolves NO.

For Kamala's odds: Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

For Iran's military action: A "military action" involves any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory, including airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count. Attacks by proxy forces do not count.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) must invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024? (b) Biden drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. Verification must come from official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. Note that this question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals occurring after July 15, 2024.

(b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024. If Biden does not drop out or remains in the race until after this time, this part resolves as "No".

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as "Yes". If neither condition is met, it resolves as "No".

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will either diplomatic expulsions/recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, or Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. This means that before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: (1) The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). (2) The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. (3) The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. (4) The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No. (b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. This resolves as Yes if he is still president at that time.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals, or (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing?
question.body:
This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as "Yes," no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as "No." If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman or Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

The resolution criteria for each part are as follows:
- For part (a), the resolution is "yes" if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee and "no" if they select a male presidential nominee.
- For part (b), the resolution is "yes" if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee and "no" if any other candidate is selected. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days (b) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
question.body: (a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024? (b) Will Donald Trump testify, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, as reported by credible sources?

question.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting. (b) According to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast, Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump on July 19, 2024, as indicated by the blue and red trend lines. If either (a) or (b) occurs, this question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through July 2024 (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. This resolves as YES if, before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.
If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as NO. This resolution criteria is based on the original Metaculus question.
